meanings.definition: A coil of wire that acts as an electromagnet when carrying an electric current.
meanings.sent1: The solenoids in the doorbell create a magnetic field when the electricity flows through them.
meanings.sent2: The solenoids in the car's starter motor help in starting the engine.
meanings.sent3: The solenoids in the robot's arm were so strong, they accidentally attracted all the metal objects in the room.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like solenoids, pulling everyone's attention towards her.
meanings.sent5: The solenoids in the MRI machine made a loud clicking sound as they activated.

meanings.definition: A type of valve that is actuated by a solenoid.
meanings.sent1: The solenoids control the flow of water in the irrigation system.
meanings.sent2: The solenoids in the sprinkler system open and close to water the garden.
meanings.sent3: The solenoids in the water fountain valve decided to take a break and stopped working.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter burst out like solenoids, spreading joy all around.
meanings.sent5: The solenoids in the vending machine clicked as they dispensed the snacks.

meanings.definition: A type of electrical device used to convert electrical energy into mechanical motion.
meanings.sent1: The solenoids in the electric lock move the bolt when activated.
meanings.sent2: The solenoids in the pinball machine control the movement of the flippers.
meanings.sent3: The solenoids in the toy robot danced around the room, entertaining everyone.
meanings.sent4: His words acted like solenoids, pushing her to take action.
meanings.sent5: The solenoids in the automatic door pushed it open smoothly as people approached.
